Class GolferScoresTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • GolferScoresTree

  • public class GolferScoresTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Primary driver for interacting with and manipulating a database of golfers via console. The data from the database is stored as a text file on disk. Golfer data is loaded from the text file into a binary tree structure for manipulation during execution of the program. This is a static class which contains static methods for printing a menu, handling menu inputs, reading golfers from a text file and adding them to a binary tree, and storing the entire binary tree to a text file.

      • loadDbFromFile

        public static TreeBag<Golfer> loadDbFromFile(java.lang.String dbFilename)
        Load a database from the specified text file in the same directory as the application.
        Parameters:
        dbFilename - name of the database file in the application directory
        Returns:
        database populated with entries in the text file
        Precondition:
        file specified by dbFilename exists in the application directory
        Postcondition:
        database object is created and returned using entries from the specified file

      • saveDbToFile

        public static void saveDbToFile(TreeBag<Golfer> db,
                                java.lang.String dbFilename)
        Write a database to the specified text file in the same directory as the application.
        Parameters:
        db - database object whose values should be written to the text file
        dbFilename - name of the database file in the application directory
        Precondition:
        file specified by dbFilename exists in the application directory
        Postcondition:
        specified text file is either created or overwritten with database entries
